data.title: Peter Martin Foster
data.text:
ObituaryThe Obituary for Peter Martin, is as follows: Thursday, January 15, 2015 10:17 am

Peter Martin Foster, Sr., of Kalamazoo, went home to be with his personal Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, Jan. 13, 2015. He was born Feb. 5, 1925, to Ernest and Sophia (Warren) Foster of Tekonsha.

He was a World War II veteran, serving in the European Theater under General Patton in Italy, Germany, and the Battle of the Bulge. Peter came home from serving his country, married Lois Jane Fish Feb. 22, 1947, in Charlotte.

He finished high school at Kalamazoo Central in 1947, and had his first son Peter Martin, Jr. in December of 1947. They moved to Oshtemo shortly after their marriage and became life long residents there.

He retired in 1983 after 33 years from the Eaton Manufacturing Co., as an inspector.

Peter leaves behind his beloved wife Lois (Fish) of 67 years.

He is survived by his children, Vickie (Kissinger/Foster, Jr.) Bennett of Portage, Glenn C. and Cherie (Kaetterhenry) Foster of Lawton, Carolyn G. (Foster) and Paul Phelps, Sr. of Oshtemo, Daniel J. and Susan (Earing) Foster of New York, Thomas S. and Mary (Kemp) Foster of Almena; 15 grandchildren, Peter Marty and (Angie) Foster III, Angela and (Brent) Simcox, (Stephanie) Foster, David and (Lacy) Foster; Heather and (Kevin) Krall, Christie and (Andrew) Leeson, Andrew and (Nicole) Foster; Paul II and (Sarah) Phelps, Marcia and (David) Brower; Daniel Foster, Jr., Casey Foster; Stephen and (Heather) Foster, Joshua Foster, Victoria Foster, Molly Foster; and 25 great-grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by his oldest son, Peter M. Jr; a grandson, Charles Foster; parents, Ernest and Sophia Foster; all of his 11 siblings and their spouses; Florence, Myrtle, Warren, Violet, Velma, Ila, Donald, Ronald, Ernest, Robert, and William.

The family will receive friends today (Friday) Jan. 16, from 4 to 7 p.m. at Life Story Funeral Homes, Betzler - Kalamazoo, 6080 Stadium Drive, (269) 375-2900. A memorial service will be held Saturday at 11 a.m. at Faith Baptist Church, Mattawan, with the Rev. Charles Rawsthorne officiating. A graveside service will be held at 2 p.m. at Mt. Ever Rest Memorial Park, Westnedge Avenue, Kalamazoo.2
